revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/162.154.64.155|162.154.64.155]] ([[User talk:162.154.64.155|talk]]): addition of [[WP:BLP|unsourced content]] to a biographical article ([[WP:HG|HG]]) (3.4.5)
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Eric Wareheim | image = EricWareheim(by_Scott_Dudelson).jpg | caption = Wareheim performing in October 2009 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1976|4|7}} | birth_place = [[Audubon, Pennsylvania|Audubon]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States of America|United States]] | occupation = Actor, comedian, writer, musician, director | spouse = |birth_name = Eric Alexander Wareheim | website = {{URL|timanderic.com}} }} '''Eric Alexander Wareheim''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|w|ɛər|h|aɪ|m}}; born April 7, 1976) is an American actor, comedian, writer, director, and musician. He is one half of the comedy duo [[Tim & Eric]], alongside [[Tim Heidecker]]. They created the television shows ''[[Tom Goes to the Mayor]]'', ''[[Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!]]'', ''[[Check It Out! with Dr. Steve Brule]]'', and ''[[Tim and Eric's Bedtime Stories]]''. He has a recurring role on the [[Netflix]] series ''[[Master of None]]''. ==Early life== Wareheim was born in [[Audubon, Pennsylvania]]. He graduated from [[Methacton High School]] in [[Norristown, Pennsylvania]] and then later attended [[Temple University]], where he met his comedy partner Tim Heidecker and produced his first film about dads, shot on the [[Jersey shore]].{{cite web |url=http://usedwigs.com/interview_timanderic.html |title=Nagging Questions for... Tim Heidecker & Eric Wareheim |year=2004 |work=UsedWigs |accessdate=2007-02-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070510050145/http://www.usedwigs.com/interview_timanderic.html |archivedate=2007-05-10 |df= }} ==Career== Wareheim and Heidecker are the creators, writers, and stars of ''[[Tom Goes to the Mayor]]'', a [[limited animation]] that was on the [[Adult Swim]] programming block on [[Cartoon Network]]. Wareheim and Heidecker had mailed copies of an early version of the show to comedian [[Bob Odenkirk]], who agreed to take on the project as the executive producer of the series and sold it to Cartoon Network.{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117946848.html?categoryid=2242&cs=1|title=10 Comics to Watch: Tim Heidecker and Eric Wareheim|first=Janelle|last=Brown|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=2006-07-17|accessdate=2007-02-16}} The Tim and Eric name was solidly branded with the release of ''[[Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!]]'' which premiered on February 11, 2007. The show is a mix of "live action, sketch, animation, emotions, phone calls, love, etc." according to their website. The creators have described the show as the "nightmare version of television".{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/07/27/arts/television/27itzk.html|title=The Bizarre Brains of Nightmare TV|first=Dave|last=Itzkoff|work=[[New York Times]]|date=2008-07-27|accessdate=2018-02-20}} On May 2, 2010 the "Man Milk" episode of "Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!" wrapped Season 5 of the show. Though this would be the last serial content for "Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!" there was an hour-long holiday program titled "Chrimbus Special" that gave fans a last glimpse at the [[TV]] program. It was the second show Wareheim both produced and starred in which aired during Cartoon Network's [[Adult Swim]] block.{{citation needed|date=February 2018}} ==Other work== ===Music career=== Wareheim played in several [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|Philadelphia]] area bands, including the new wave punk band Twelve Tone System, of which Tim Heidecker was also briefly a member. Wareheim briefly played backup guitar for the duo Adam and Justine in the 1990s. Wareheim was also the principal songwriter for The Science Of and had been a member of Elements of Need, I Am Heaven, and briefly with the Vampire-themed punk band [[Ink & Dagger]].{{cite web |url=http://www.alarmpress.com/2991/music-interview/philadelphia-based-paint-it-black-make-hardcore-personal-again |title=Paint it Black: making hardcore personal again |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081015081105/http://www.alarmpress.com/2991/music-interview/philadelphia-based-paint-it-black-make-hardcore-personal-again/ |archivedate=2008-10-15 |df= }} He currently is involved with the band Sola.{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/sola-mn0001926761/biography |title=Artist Biography by Jason Birchmeier |accessdate=2017-03-29}} ===Film career=== Wareheim made an appearance in ''[[Aqua Teen Hunger Force]]'' as the Germ-Master, along with Heidecker as a basketball. Wareheim, along with Tim Heidecker, also directed the 2010 Super Bowl commercial, The Shuffle, for Boost Mobile and most recently a series of [[Old Spice]] commercials with actor [[Terry Crews]]. They also made an appearance in an episode of ''[[The Simpsons]]'' as Amus Bruse and Fois Garth. Wareheim and Heidecker appeared together as [[Collection agency|Debt Collectors]] on the [[Adult Swim]] special, ''[[Young Person's Guide to History|The Young Persons Guide to History]]'' and have made guest appearances in the movie ''[[Let's Go to Prison]]'', as well as the Scottish video game series ''[[VideoGaiden]]'' and a Version 2 episode of ''[[Mega64]]''.{{cite web | url = https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0793166/ | title = "Mega64": Stranger | year = | work = IMDb | accessdate = 2009-02-23}} Wareheim also played a recurring role in [[Michael Cera]]'s and [[Clark Duke]]'s Internet TV show ''[[Clark and Michael]]'' as Randy, the neighbor of the titular duo.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z6mvUkFFVJQ&feature=youtu.be|title=Clark and Michael - Episode 1|first=|last=CBS|date=21 April 2009|publisher=|via=YouTube}} Using characters and skits from Awesome Show, Heidecker and Wareheim (via their [[Abso Lutely Productions]] company) created an online-only show called ''[[Tim and Eric Nite Live!]]'', originally broadcast on the website [[SuperDeluxe]]. In 2015, Wareheim co-starred as Arnold Baumheiser in the [[Netflix]] comedy series ''[[Master of None]]''. He appeared in six episodes and directed four episodes of the first season. In 2017, he appeared in seven episodes and directed a single episode of the show's second season. ===Music videos=== * "Polite Dance Song" – [[The Bird and the Bee]] (2007)[http://vimeo.com/2128833 The Bird and the Bee "Polite Dance Song" on Vimeo]. Vimeo.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "[[You Don't Know Me (Ben Folds song)|You Don't Know Me]]" – [[Ben Folds]] (feat. [[Regina Spektor]]) (co-directed by [[Tim Heidecker]]) (2008)[http://vimeo.com/2130344 Ben Folds "You Don't Know Me" on Vimeo]. Vimeo.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "''Dance Floor Dale''" – a music video for the song "Parisian Goldfish" by [[Flying Lotus]] (2008)[http://www.dancefloordale.com/ video – Eric Wareheim (Tim and Eric), Flying Lotus and Warp] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090626234631/http://www.dancefloordale.com/ |date=2009-06-26 }}. Dance Floor Dale. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "Parisian Goldfish" – [[Flying Lotus]] (2008) (Co-directed with [[Eric Fensler]])[http://www.dancefloordale.com video – Eric Wareheim (Tim and Eric), Flying Lotus and Warp] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090626234631/http://www.dancefloordale.com/ |date=2009-06-26 }}. Dance Floor Dale. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "The Youth" – [[MGMT]] (2008)[http://vimeo.com/1932058 MGMT "The Youth" on Vimeo]. Vimeo.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "[[If I Never See Your Face Again]] ([[Swizz Beatz]] Remix)" – [[Maroon 5]] (2008)[http://vimeo.com/2501442 Maroon 5 "If I Never See Your Face Again" on Vimeo]. Vimeo.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "Dropped" – [[Phantom Planet]] (2009)[http://vimeo.com/2655608 Phantom Planet "Dropped" on Vimeo]. Vimeo.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "[[She's Got Me Dancing]]" – [[Tommy Sparks]] (2009)[http://vimeo.com/3884738 Tommy Sparks "She's Got Me Dancing" on Vimeo]. Vimeo.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "[[Guns Don't Kill People... Lazers Do|Keep it Goin' Louder]]" – [[Major Lazer]] (2009)[http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoid=100807660 Video Keep It Goin' Louder van Major Lazer – Myspace Video] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091231123317/http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&VideoID=100807660 |date=2009-12-31 }}. Vids.myspace.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "[[Pon De Floor]]" – [[Major Lazer]] (2009)[http://vimeo.com/5936810 Major Lazer "Pon De Floor" on Vimeo]. Vimeo.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "Buffalo Stance" – [[Need New Body]][https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YpwDnyygPLE Need New Body – Buffalo Stance]. YouTube (2008-01-22). Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "Hole to Feed" – [[Depeche Mode]] (2009)[http://vimeo.com/6772569 Depeche Mode "Hole To Feed" on Vimeo]. Vimeo.com. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "We Are Water" – [[Health (band)|Health]] (2010)[https://www.youtube.com/user/ericwareheim#p/a/u/0/toG4bHjPLEU Kanaal van ericwareheim]. YouTube. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. * "Wishes" – [[Beach House]] (2013)[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OS6duOoxctw]. YouTube. Retrieved on 2013-03-08. * "Backpacker Bush" – Dutch Boys featuring Twankstar (2013) * "[[Bubble Butt]]" – [[Major Lazer]] (2013){{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hR-NXv5Tma0|title=Major Lazer - Bubble Butt (feat. Bruno Mars, 2 Chainz, Tyga & Mystic) - Directed by Eric Wareheim|publisher=}} * "Die" – Babes (2014){{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jtwIuGxMhAs|title=Babes - Die|first=|last=BabesVEVO|date=22 April 2014|publisher=|via=YouTube}} * "Streaker" – [[Tobacco (musician)|Tobacco]] (2014)[http://vimeo.com/91776291 Tobacco "Streaker" on Vimeo]. * "HAM" – [[Mr. Oizo]] (2014)[https://vimeo.com/112974995 Mr. Oizo "HAM" on Vimeo]. * "Famous" – [[Charli XCX]] (2015){{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5f5A4DnGtis#t=19|title=Charli XCX - Famous [Official Music Video YTMAs]|first=|last=Charli XCX|date=23 March 2015|publisher=|via=YouTube}} * "Dripping" – [[Blonde Redhead]] (2016){{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1q5LfmdpUQ4|title=Blonde Redhead - "Dripping" Music Video|publisher=}} ===Billion Dollar Movie=== Wareheim also co-directed, wrote and starred in ''[[Tim and Eric's Billion Dollar Movie]]'' with Tim Heidecker.{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117946862?refcatid=31|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|accessdate=February 20, 2012|date=January 21, 2012|author=Anderson, John|title=Tim and Eric's Billion Dollar Movie}} ===''Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!'' spinoffs=== Between May and June 2010, six episodes of an ''Awesome Show'' spin-off produced in part by Wareheim, ''[[Check It Out! with Dr. Steve Brule]]'', were aired on Cartoon Network. The show parodied [[local news]]casts. According to Heidecker, [[John C. Reilly]] had the original idea of giving the Dr. Steve character an entire show.''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' article: "[http://www.vanityfair.com/online/oscars/2009/07/qa-tim-and-eric-on-child-abuse-diarrhea-and-yerba-mate-tea.html Q&A: Tim and Eric on Child Abuse, Diarrhea, and Yerba-Mate Tea] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100328080729/http://www.vanityfair.com/online/oscars/2009/07/qa-tim-and-eric-on-child-abuse-diarrhea-and-yerba-mate-tea.html |date=2010-03-28 }}". In a July 2008 ''New York Times'' article, it was reported that the duo was in the process of developing a surreal [[game show]] series starring [[Neil Hamburger]], titled ''The New Big Ball with Neil Hamburger''.''[[New York Times]]'' article: "[https://www.nytimes.com/2008/07/27/arts/television/27itzk.html?_r=1&ref=television&oref=slogin The Bizarre Brains of Nightmare TV]".''Hardford Advocate'' article: "[http://www.hartfordadvocate.com/article.cfm?aid=9112 Hamburger Helper: America's 'worst' comedian performs in New Haven and then in Northampton]". Wareheim described it as a mix between "[[Japanese variety show|Japanese bizarre game show]] and ''[[The Price Is Right]]''." In late July 2009, Neil Hamburger posted a blog on [[MySpace]] stating that a [[pilot (television)|pilot]] had been filmed, but that Adult Swim was not satisfied and had "pulled the plug on the project."[[MySpace]] blog post by [[Neil Hamburger]]: "[http://blogs.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=blog.view&friendId=53055268&blogId=501569194 The New Big Ball] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090207065936/http://blogs.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=blog.view |date=2009-02-07 }}". ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
